allergic_reaction.description: An allergic reaction may include symptoms such as itching, swelling, and rashes.
steps: Identify and remove the allergen if possible.
Administer antihistamines if prescribed.
For severe reactions, use an epinephrine auto-injector if available.
Seek medical attention immediately if symptoms are severe or worsening.

arthritis_in_hands.description: Arthritis in hands causes pain, swelling, and stiffness in the joints.
steps: Apply heat or cold packs to relieve pain and swelling.
Perform gentle hand exercises to maintain flexibility.
Use over-the-counter pain relievers as needed.
Consult a healthcare provider for personalized treatment and medication.

burns.description: Burns can result from heat, chemicals, or electricity and cause damage to the skin.
steps: Cool the burn under running cold water for at least 10 minutes.
Cover the burn with a sterile, non-stick bandage.
Avoid applying ice, butter, or ointments.
Seek medical attention for severe burns or if blisters develop.

chickenpox_rash.description: Chickenpox rash consists of itchy red spots that develop into fluid-filled blisters.
steps: Keep the affected area clean and avoid scratching.
Use calamine lotion or antihistamines to relieve itching.
Take lukewarm baths with baking soda or colloidal oatmeal.
Consult a healthcare provider for antiviral medication if necessary.

cold_sore_symptoms.description: Cold sores are caused by the herpes simplex virus and appear as small, fluid-filled blisters around the mouth.
steps: Apply antiviral cream or ointment as prescribed.
Avoid close contact with others, especially newborns and pregnant women.
Keep the affected area clean and dry.
Avoid touching the sores and wash hands frequently.

deep_cut.description: A deep cut or laceration requires prompt care to prevent infection and promote healing.
steps: Apply pressure to stop bleeding.
Clean the wound gently with water and mild soap.
Cover with a sterile bandage or dressing.
Seek medical attention to determine if stitches are needed or to assess for possible infection.

fracture.description: A fracture is a break or crack in a bone that requires immediate attention.
steps: Immobilize the injured area with a splint or by tying it to a nearby body part.
Apply ice to reduce swelling.
Elevate the injured limb if possible.
Seek medical attention immediately for proper diagnosis and treatment.

gout.description: Gout is a type of arthritis characterized by sudden and severe pain, redness, and swelling in the joints, often the big toe.
steps: Rest the affected joint and elevate it if possible.
Apply ice to reduce swelling and pain.
Take over-the-counter anti-inflammatory medications or medications prescribed by a doctor.
Consult a healthcare provider for long-term management and dietary advice.
